Reviewed by Sherman Smith

Source: Kanopy.com

Are you ready to dive into the world of movie trivia? Get ready to hop, skip, and jump through 40 fascinating facts about the classic film Hopscotch. Released in 1980, Hopscotch is a comedy-thriller that combines action, espionage, and perfectly timed comedic moments. Starring the legendary actor Walter Matthau, Hopscotch takes audiences on a thrilling ride as ex-CIA agent Miles Kendig goes on the run to publish his explosive memoirs. This hidden gem of a film boasts a talented cast, clever writing, and a unique blend of humor and suspense. So, dust off your spy glasses and settle in as we uncover intriguing behind-the-scenes tidbits, interesting trivia, and little-known facts about the movie Hopscotch.

Key Takeaways:

Hopscotch is a witty spy comedy from 1980, featuring clever tactics, global adventure, and a charming romance. Its enduring popularity influenced future spy films with its unique blend of humor and espionage.

The movie’s success led to a Broadway adaptation, a video game, and a TV series. Its timeless themes of loyalty, betrayal, and personal freedom continue to resonate with audiences today.
